A: Please no more of the two-sentence "bios".  Also also, please don't have bios that tell us nothing that isn't already said clearly by their in-game actions and abilities ({{champion:150}}) or that outright _clash_ with their in-game actions and abilities ({{champion:81}}).

2: With the death of the Institute of War and the removal of the League of Legends from the game _League of Legends_ (Yes, I'm still mad about that stupid decision, but I'll move right along), many champions are now story-orphans with few or no links to other characters or the nations of Runterra.  Off the top of my head, I'm thinking of people like {{champion:10}}, {{champion:25}}, {{champion:44}}, {{champion:9}}, {{champion:24}}...  I could keep going.  You've also made the same mistake with more recent champions like {{champion:432}}; Just because they are a figure of legend doesn't make them any good for stories in _League of Legends_, especially when they exist in their own little isolated bubble, never interacting with other characters.

Oh, and one last thing.  I know I said I wasn't going to talk any more about the Great Retcon.  I lied.
I know I'm not going to convince you to change anything back or anything, but please just know that people loved those old stories.  So please, **please** be respectful to them and keep what you can when you can.  As a random example, please don't up and give {{champion:24}} a polearm or something; Even without the League of Legends, the big point of his old story is that he kicks ass with anything in his hands, even something as ridiculous as a lamppost, and he find fighting with a weapon boring because he's too skilled with them.  Yes, it's crazy and over-the-top, but that's what we love about him.

"Let us know if there are some that you really want to see updated."

Personally, I'd like the see the rewriting of old lore stop. Like I get it some people don't fit, (Udyr for example) but then just lump them in with another champion's lore rework? There is already an abundance or lore that is available to work with. Like if we go back to Udyr and the Freljord rework, Tyrndamere was nowhere to be seen, but Udyr got lumped in? 

Personally I'd like to see more "next chapters" take champions that have lore, and expanded it, make it relevant again. For example, Poppy, tragic back story, solid reason for joining the league. Have the next champion released be from Noxus and have Poppy recognize her fathers assassin. Boom, simple, do a cool story mode like with the GP rework. And you bring back multiple champions while showcasing champions that are old or have just been reworked.

Rito - "We want to strengthen the core thematic of the champs, and further explore their motivations, personality and background. For most of our champs, that’s simply adding more depth to what’s already there, and really getting to dive into what drives them."

Except for trundle. For trundle, you took everything that we loved about him deleted it, and gave him a completely new bio that's just pointless and boring. "He's a troll who found a magic ice club so he can smash things!" Yea, that's totally a much more intriguing backstory than a troll cursed with a disease that literally rots his flesh at the same speed that he regenerates it, locking him in a cycle of pain and renewal. Traditional Trundle was one of my favorites and I loved him... but I shouldn't really be complaining. At least he got a traditional skin, unlike Gangplank and Sion.

I know that you guys are working really hard to take old champs and point them in a direction that's deeper and more interesting, but some of my favorite champs had their personalities trampled into the dust, and I'm honestly scared that the trend of "Fuck the old canon and re-write everything!" will continue. I personally loved Sion as a goofy axeman whose undeath let him be careless, and gangplank the butt pirate always made me laugh. I know that fighting is a serious thing, but trundle, Gangplank, and Sion represent the much needed comic relief that's been disregarded as of late.

Rito - "As we work to expand out our bios, the most important thing is that we hold true to the core essence of why players love that particular champ."
